intro: Scorzonera calvescens, commonly known as the Italian salsify, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy roots that are often harvested for culinary use. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and prefers well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and daisy-like. Scorzonera calvescens is also valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in traditional medicine.
